My Projects

A collection of my cybersecurity, homelab, and technology projects.

Snipe-IT

Open-source IT asset management system that helps track hardware, software licenses, accessories, and consumables across my home lab.

Read Blog PostView on GitHub
Wireshark

Network protocol analyzer for packet inspection and troubleshooting. Essential for understanding network traffic.

Read Blog Post
Wazuh

Open-Source SIEM and EDR solution. Provides a method of aggregating logs and managing configurations.

Read Blog Post
Raspberry Pi 5: Tools

A Raspberry Pi 5 that I setup with various tools and a remote connection. It allows me to plug into any network and have access to installed tools.

Read Blog Post
Pwnagotchi aka Bobby

Pwnagotchi is a wifi hacking tool created with a Raspberry Pi Zero 2W. My children came up with the name Bobby.

Read Blog PostView on GitHub
Meshtastic Radios

These radios use long range wireless communication (LoRa) to send messages between devices without using other services such as cellular or Wi-Fi.

Read Blog PostView on GitHub
Kali Nethunter

This is a old phone that I rooted and installed Kali NetHunter on.

Read Blog Post
Nvidia Jetson Orin Nano Super

This is a Jetson Orin Nano developer kit that I purchased to mess around with machine learning.

OMG Cable

This is an OMG cable that I purchased to practice penetration testing.

Raspberry Pi Zero 2W

This is Raspberry Pi Zero 2W that I bought for a web server. I have also experimented with using it as a VPN gateway with a PoE hat.

Proxmox Virtual Environment

This wasn't the first virtualization platform that I tried, but it is the one that I will continue to use. It is open-source, feature-rich, and free for personal and business use.
